Calling Women Entrepreneurs in MedTech & CleanTech!
IKP EDEN is excited to announce an Ask Us Anything (AUA) session for BioXcelerate â€“ a flagship program under the WEscalate Initiative powered by K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society IT BT Department, Karnataka.

BioXcelerate offers a structured 6-month incubation phase followed by a 6-month acceleration phase, with a clear focus on translating high-potential science into scalable and sustainable ventures.

Date: 11th July at 6 PM
Location - IKP EDEN (Maps:Â goo.gl/ur42sk)
Registration Link for AUA - https://lnkd.in/gvH_RGJs
Click here to apply for the program - https://lnkd.in/gDeybQHM (Last date to apply : 26th July, 2025)

This is an excellent opportunity for women entrepreneurs working in MedTech, CleanTech, and allied sectors to learn more about the program and explore how it can support your growth journey.

Join us to ask your questions, gain clarity, and take the next big step in your entrepreneurial journey.
Stay tuned for more updates!

IKP EDEN had the pleasure of hosting Kei Iiyama and Dr. Sharath R from Sakra Hospitals. It was an insightful introductory meeting where we showcased the work IKP Knowledge Park and IKP EDEN are doing to support innovation and nurture high-impact hardware & deeptech startups

Startups like Cureous Cartosense and others had the opportunity to engage with the Sakra team and share their journeys and technologies. We also had the opportunity to walk them through our facility and the infrastructure we provide to early-stage ventures.

IKP EDEN is excited about the potential synergies and are looking forward to co-creating opportunities that can accelerate MedTech innovation and deliver scalable healthcare solutions.
Collaboration like this strengthens the ecosystemâ€”and we're just getting started!

We are constantly inspired by purpose-driven solutions that tackle critical public health challenges at the grassroots.
 
Bengaluru-based Janitri Innovations, an IKP-supported, startup quietly transforming maternal and newborn health through frugal innovation, is a powerful reminder that big change often begins with small, thoughtful steps.
 
We celebrate ventures that combine empathy and engineering to create scalable, life-saving interventions.
 
Janitri is supported by programs like AGC JanCARE, a part of our portfolio, and is incubated at IKP EDEN. As ecosystem enablers, stories like these reinforce our belief in nurturing science and technology for inclusive growth.

Catalyzing Change: Expert Visit and Startup interaction at BBB 

Â We were delighted to host theÂ Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) officials and seniorÂ dignitariesÂ for aÂ site visit and strategic interactionÂ at our incubator onÂ 3rd July 2025Â at BSC BioNEST Bioincubator,  Regional Centre for Biotechnology.Â  

Â The day began with insightful remarks fromÂ Dr. Arvind Sahu, Executive Director, RCB, andÂ Dr. Jitendra Kumar, MD, BIRAC, followed by an overview of our initiatives byÂ Ms. Suman Gupta, COO, BBB.Â  

A special highlight of the day was theÂ sharing mentorship and guidanceÂ by leading and matured bioincubators â€“Â Dr.Â Â Deepanwita Chattopadhyay,Â Â IKP (Hyderabad), Dr. Mrutyunjay Suar, PhD ,Â KIIT - Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Bhubaneswar), andÂ Dr. Ramjee Pallela,Â CCMB (Hyderabad). Their valuable insights on sustainable growth models, startup support systems, and operational excellence were deeply appreciated.

Â The visit also featured:
-A walkthrough of BBBâ€™s advanced infrastructure and incubation facilities.
-LivelyÂ interactions between resident startups, where innovative ideas, challenges, and future aspirations were shared.
-Strategic discussions culminating in thoughtfulÂ recommendations and a roadmap for strengthening BBBâ€™s offerings.

We are grateful to all,Â seniorÂ dignitaries,Â mentors, and stakeholders who participated and enriched the day with their insights and guidance.
Together, we continue to build a robust ecosystem for biotech innovation in India.

#Fundraise alert! Kudos to Loopworm, incubated at CCAMP, for raising USD 3.25 Million in pre-Series A funding round! This latest funding was led by WaterBridge Ventures, an existing investor, and ENRISSION INDIA CAPITAL INC., a Japanese venture capital firm

https://lnkd.in/gqFP37jt

Loopworm has developed a new approach to producing recombinant proteins using silkworms which will target diagnostics, animal vaccines and other applications. Their current portfolio of products include insect-based value-added solutions like animal feed, recombinant proteins, biomolecules and crop biostimulants which are already in the Indian, EU and other global markets

We congratulate the entire team!

Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) threatens health & development globally.

At the India AMR Innovation Workshop at Centre for Cellular and Molecular Platforms (C-CAMP) Dr. Ekroop Caur  IAS, urged global partnerships for a collective and coordinated effort to tackle AMR.

Dr. Ekroop Caur  invited all stakeholders, including international agencies, to partner with IT BT Department, Karnataka. "Let Karnataka be your innovation lab, your testing ground, your policy partner in this national mission. May the deliberations of this workshop be productive, the collaboration enduring, and the impact transformative â€” not just for Karnataka, but for India and the world."

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized an insightful workshop titled "Understanding Patent & IP Management: Basic Processes for Startup Success", led by Sneha Kanitkar, Founder of PatentSky.

The session focused on empowering early-stage entrepreneurs with essential knowledge to legally protect their technologies and innovations. Key topics included:

 ðŸ“Œ Filing processes for various types of Intellectual Property (IP)
 ðŸ“Œ Tangible vs. intangible assets

 ðŸ“Œ Terms and scope of IP protection

ðŸŽ“ Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! ðŸ§ ðŸš€

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundationâ€™s lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrowâ€™s challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! ðŸŒ±ðŸ’¡

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Daamini Sharma | Dr. Adithya Hande
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering Bangalore | Dayananda Sagar Institutions | Don Bosco Institute of Technology (DBIT), Bengaluru

#FacultyDevelopment #DERBIFoundation #InnovationCampus #DSBA #StartupIndia #AcademiaToInnovation #EntrepreneurialMindset #FutureReadyEducation #IncubationEcosystem #KudluGate #InnovationTour

We at DERBI Foundation, were delighted to host Dr.Panneerselvam ( PS ) Madanagopal, CEO of MeitY Startup Hub, to review the progress of the #MeitY_SAMRIDH accelerator program and explore deeper collaboration.

Dr. Madanagopal toured our incubation and innovation infrastructure, interacted with our team, and had insightful discussions around our strategy to support high-potential startups working in deeptech startups

He also engaged with the SAMRIDH startup cohort, listening to their journeys and feedback on how the program is helping them build scalable, impactful ventures, with support from MeitY Startup Hub and the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

Weâ€™re excited to deepen our partnership and continue enabling early-stage startups with the resources, mentorship, and market access they need to succeed.

Belagavi,Â Gets a Boost of AI Brilliance with its UNNATI AI workshop at KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research!

The UNNATI AI Workshop, organized by FITT, IIT Delhi in collaboration with Microsoft, was hosted at the KAHER Incubation and Innovation Foundation, KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research, Belagavi, Karnataka, brought together a dynamic ecosystem of students, startups, and innovators - all driven by the shared vision of transforming ideas into real-world AI solutions.

The highlight? FITT introduced its flagship UNNATI AI Accelerator, offering grant support of up to â‚¹30 Lakhs to selected innovators ready to scale impactful AI-based solutions.

Another key moment was the insightful session by ITTO (Innovation-Technology Transfer Office Foundation for Innovation Technology Transfer), which opened doors for participants to explore global pathways for deep tech commercialization and innovation transfer.

Special thanks to Dr. Preeti K. Doddwad, M.D.S., Professor, Dept. of Conservative Dentistry and Co-ordinator, KLE English Medium Schools, and Dr. Neha Dhaded, Associate Professor, KLE Vishwanath Katti Institute of Dental Sciences, for their support and coordination.

We extend our heartfelt appreciation to KIIF for hosting the FITT - IIT Delhi's team and for their integral role in the success of this collaborative initiative.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
In agriculture, productivity is only part of the story. 

Without efficient post-harvest systems, much of whatâ€™s grown is lost, or sold at distress prices. 

Farmers need access to infrastructure that preserves produce quality, extends shelf-life life, and enables value addition. For perishable crops, in particular, the time between harvest and sale is critical. 

Weâ€™re inviting start-ups developing solutions for: 

- Affordable, accessible preservation and processingÂ 
- Modular storage with hybrid or passive coolingÂ 
- Off-grid or decentralised post-harvest infrastructureÂ 
- Quality monitoring, grading, and traceability 

Solutions should be relevant to smallholder farmers, and adaptable to a range of crops and geographies.Â 
Â 
Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and design support, incubation, mentorship, and access to scale-up networks.
Â 
Applications close on 13th July 2025.Â Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#NewBlogAlert: Climate change isnâ€™t tomorrowâ€™s problem, itâ€™s todayâ€™s reality. Its health impacts are already worsening global inequalities, with a 68% increase in heat-related deaths among vulnerable populations. The effects extend beyond physical health, climate change is taking a serious toll on mental health too, with climate anxiety rising sharply, especially among young people.

In our latest blog, our Board member, and the founder of Social Alpha, Manoj Kumar explores how climate volatility is disrupting disease ecology and why we need an innovation-driven ecosystem to anticipate, adapt, and protect both present and future generations.

Read Now: http://bit.ly/3T7Ka7B

#IndiaHealthFund #ClimateChange #ClimateHealthInnovation #HealthcareChallenges

Impact investing and blended finance were supposed to fund what the market wouldnâ€™tâ€”ideas that are too early, too complex, too local, or too long-term. Instead, they have become vehicles for funding what the market already wants, just with less risk and more narrative dressing.

We recently hosted a fantastic "Founder's Playbook: Smart Moves for Sustainable Startups" hybrid session, engaging around 30 entrepreneurs both online and in our auditorium! It was a powerful experience diving into strategic growth for new startups.

The session, expertly led by Dipanjay Bhalerao, Deputy Director, Indira Institute of Management, Pune (MBA), offered practical and thought-provoking insights:

â€¢ Strategic Startup Categorization: Participants gained clarity on distinguishing between High/Low Investment and Innovation models, prompting them to assess their own ventures.

â€¢ The B.I.O. Model: Mr. Bhalerao introduced his impactful Business, Investment, and Offering Innovation model, illustrated with compelling examples of capex reduction, smart outsourcing (like Airtel), and revenue streams (like Apple's app ecosystem).

â€¢ Innovation vs. Disruption: A crucial discussion that provided a clearer understanding of these pivotal concepts.

â€¢ The Power of Collaboration: Emphasizing how partnerships drive significant growth in the startup ecosystem.

A huge thank you to Dipanjay Bhalerao for sharing his profound knowledge and making the session so valuable. We also extend our gratitude to all the entrepreneurs who actively participated and made this event a resounding success!

#portfolio newsletter: As we close the chapter on an exciting FY 2024-25, we are excited to recount our progress and notable achievements within our equity portfolio. 

This year, our portfolio of 72 deep-tech ventures has advanced on multiple fronts, including the rising participation of women founders and the steady global traction of our startups. Here are the other top highlights:

(1) Five startups from the Venture Center portfolio have now crossedÂ $10 million USD in valuation

(2) 80 products commercialized by our investees, many of whom were early-stage startups at the time of investing and navigated complex regulatory pathways. 

(3) Rs. 363 crores raised in cumulative follow-on funding by our portfolio startups, which is 13X the investment of Rs 28 crores by Venture Center.

(4) 200 intellectual property filed , including 97 patents, 91 trademarks, and 12 copyright, highliting the novelty of the technologies of our investees.

(5) Rs. 178.60 crores total provisional revenue reported by portfolio startups in FY 2024â€“25 â€” a strong indicator of market traction and growing customer adoption.

Weâ€™d love to discuss coâ€‘investment opportunities or set up a call to explore how you can engage as a co-investor orÂ contribute your expertise, and be part of the next wave of deep-tech venturesÂ from India.

This talk will simplify key aspects of spinouts:

What exactly is a spinoutâ€”and how does it differ from a regular startup?
Why are spinouts created, and how does the process work?
Can you launch a spinout without quitting your current job?
What's the long-term value of spinouts for individuals, institutions, and society?
Lessons from the real world: examples and case studies.
Navigating institutional policies and administrative challenges.

Who should attend? ðŸ‘¥
This session is perfect for:
Academicians & Science Faculty engaged in innovative research
Research and Business Development Heads
Directors and Key Policymakers
Researchers and Industry Collaborators

About the Speaker:
Dr. Premnath Venugopalan is Head, NCL Innovations/ Chief Scientist at CSIR-NCL and Founder Director, Venture Center (National award winning inventive enterprises and deep tech incubator). Dr Premnath is a technology developer, innovation and incubation manager, startup mentor and a co-founder of 2 medtech startups. One of his inventions -- a breakthrough material for hip and knee joint replacements has been implanted in more than a million patients worldwide. Another technology for porous maxillo-facial implants has been implanted in thousands of patients in India and abroad. He has provided leadership for teams that have won National awards for technology development, intellectual property management and business incubation. He is chemical engineer and an alumnus of MIT in the US, IIT-Bombay (Distinguished Alumnus, 2022) and has been a Chevening Technology Enterprise Scholar in Cambridge, UK. He is also a Registered Technology Transfer Professional (RTTP). He has led award-winning teams in technology development, IP management, and business incubation, and has facilitated the creation of over 12 spinouts!

Don't miss this opportunity to understand the power and potential of spinouts!

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders whoâ€™ve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.
